7.96.text:
I served in the Navy for 38
years, ultimately culminated

12.42.text:
with service as the
head of our Navy--

14.17.text:
which is called the Chief
of Naval Operations--

16.72.text:
and was also a member of
the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

20.16.text:
I think, as we look into
the next administration

24.60.text:
and it's very easy to try to
identify a particular country

28.77.text:
or region, I think
our challenge will be,

33.12.text:
how do we deal
with something that

36.01.text:
may be happening in
the South China Sea

38.76.text:
at the same time as
Afghanistan, Syria,

47.33.text:
How do we manage and how
do we employ our forces who

55.24.text:
And how do we balance all
those competing demands?

58.51.text:
How does the commander in
chief, the administration

65.76.text:
why those areas are
important, why we have

69.27.text: a role in shaping events there?

73.63.text:
And I would say
a component piece

75.95.text:
of that is really solidifying
our alliance relationships that

82.49.text:
exist around the
world and developing

87.31.text:
those alliances in ways that are

91.22.text:
I think the
challenges that we're

92.59.text:
going to face over
10 or 15 years

94.72.text:
is the narrowing
technological gap in warfare.

100.93.text:
And how we maintain that
technological edge is

105.35.text:
How do we continue
to attract and retain

109.05.text:
the great young people that
are the ones that really go out

111.51.text:
and do the hard work, that
put their lives on the line?

116.26.text:
And we have to make sure that
there is an attractiveness,

120.41.text:
that there's a
commitment on the part

121.95.text:
of the young people of the
country to continue to do that.

125.09.text:
As we move farther
into the future,

128.77.text:
I really do believe that, while
not an existential problem,

134.74.text:
we are going to begin to see the
physical changes to our planet

145.10.text:
how populations
are having to deal

149.70.text:
But this is one that I believe
requires a global view.

153.86.text:
I applaud the agreements,
the arrangements.

157.52.text:
We better be getting
ready for the changes

160.45.text:
that are taking place
